meanings.definition: The quality of being trustworthy or dependable.
meanings.sent1: Her reliabilities in keeping secrets made her a trusted friend.
meanings.sent2: The reliabilities of the old watch were proven when it never missed a beat.
meanings.sent3: The reliabilities of the weather forecast were so accurate that it even predicted a surprise snowstorm.
meanings.sent4: His reliabilities in fixing things were like having a magic touch.
meanings.sent5: The reliabilities of the compass guided them safely through the dense forest.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be relied upon.
meanings.sent1: The reliabilities of the bridge were questioned after the recent earthquake.
meanings.sent2: She tested the reliabilities of the new software by running multiple simulations.
meanings.sent3: The reliabilities of the rumor mill were so exaggerated that it became a game of telephone.
meanings.sent4: His reliabilities in meeting deadlines were unmatched in the office.
meanings.sent5: The reliabilities of the map were crucial for their journey through the unknown terrain.

meanings.definition: The ability of a system or component to perform its required functions under stated conditions for a specified period of time.
meanings.sent1: The reliabilities of the engine were put to the test during the endurance race.
meanings.sent2: The team analyzed the reliabilities of the new software before implementing it company-wide.
meanings.sent3: The reliabilities of the alarm system were so sensitive that even a mouse triggered it.
meanings.sent4: His reliabilities in troubleshooting computer issues were like having a tech wizard on call.
meanings.sent5: The reliabilities of the safety equipment ensured the workers' protection in hazardous conditions.
